org.codice.solr.factory.impl

Class HttpSolrClientFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.codice.solr.factory.impl.HttpSolrClientFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SolrClientFactory

    public class HttpSolrClientFactory
extends Object
implements SolrClientFactory
    Factory class used to create new HttpSolrClient instances.
    Uses the following system properties when creating an instance:
    • solr.data.dir: Absolute path to the directory where the Solr data will be stored
    • solr.http.url: Solr server URL
    • org.codice.ddf.system.threadPoolSize: Solr query thread pool size
    • https.protocols: Secure protocols supported by the Solr server
    • https.cipherSuites: Cipher suites supported by the Solr server

    • Method Detail

      • newClient

        public Future<org.apache.solr.client.solrj.SolrClient> newClient(String core)
        Description copied from interface: SolrClientFactory
        Requests the creation of a new SolrClient for a specific Solr core name.
        Note that Future.get() will return null if a SolrClient could not be created either immediately or after a retry period determined by the implementing class. Clients of this class should consider implementing retry logic if needed based on that return value.
        Specified by:
        newClient in interface SolrClientFactory
        Parameters:
        core - name of the Solr core to create
        Returns:
        Future used to retrieve the new SolrClient created

      • getHttpSolrClient

        public static Future<org.apache.solr.client.solrj.SolrClient> getHttpSolrClient(@Nullable
                                                                                String url)
        Creates a new HttpSolrClient using the URL provided. Uses the default Solr core name () and configuration file ("solrconfig.xml").
        Parameters:
        url - Solr server URL. If null, defaults to the system's base URL followed by /solr.
        Returns:
        Future used to retrieve the new HttpSolrClient instance

      • getHttpSolrClient

        public static Future<org.apache.solr.client.solrj.SolrClient> getHttpSolrClient(@Nullable
                                                                                String url,
                                                                                String coreName)
        Creates a new HttpSolrClient using the URL and core name provided. Uses the default configuration file ("solrconfig.xml").
        Parameters:
        url - Solr server URL. If null, defaults to the system's base URL followed by /solr.
        coreName - name of the Solr core to create
        Returns:
        Future used to retrieve the new HttpSolrClient instance

      • getHttpSolrClient

        public static Future<org.apache.solr.client.solrj.SolrClient> getHttpSolrClient(@Nullable
                                                                                String url,
                                                                                String coreName,
                                                                                @Nullable
                                                                                String configFile)
        Creates a new HttpSolrClient using the URL, core name and configuration file name provided.
        Parameters:
        url - Solr server URL. If null, defaults to the system's base URL followed by /solr.
        coreName - name of the Solr core to create
        configFile - configuration file name. If null, defaults to "solrconfig.xml".
        Returns:
        Future used to retrieve the new HttpSolrClient instance
